newsitem.title: FINLAND: German buy makes Enso Europe's number two paper maker.
newsitem.headline: German buy makes Enso Europe's number two paper maker.

text.p: Finnish forestry group Enso Oy said Monday it was buying German paper manufacturer E. Holtzmann for 1.8 billion markka ($346.2 million), making it Europe's second largest producer of paper and board.
Enso said its initial purchase of a 50.4 percent majority stake in the German company would boost its overall annual capacity by 700,000 metric tons to 6.7 million.
That puts Enso ahead of Sweden's Stora but still clearly behind Finnish rival UPM-Kymmene.
